definitions.definition: A very unpleasant or frightening dream .
examples: I had a nightmare that I tried to run but could neither move nor breathe.

definitions.definition: Any bad , miserable , difficult or terrifying situation or experience that arouses anxiety , terror , agony or great displeasure .
examples: Cleaning up after identity theft can be a nightmare of phone calls and letters.

definitions.definition: A demon or monster, thought to plague people while they slept and cause a feeling of suffocation and terror during sleep.
A feeling of extreme anxiety or suffocation experienced during sleep; Sleep paralysis .

main_definition: A very unpleasant or frightening dream . [from 19th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( figuratively ) Any bad , miserable , difficult or terrifying situation or experience that arouses anxiety , terror , agony or great displeasure . [from 20th c.]
( now rare ) A demon or monster, thought to plague people while they slept and cause a feeling of suffocation and terror during sleep. [from 14th c.]
( now chiefly historical ) A feeling of extreme anxiety or suffocation experienced during sleep; Sleep paralysis . [from 16th c.]
